item.title: About Us
item.dc:creator: admin1
item.content:encoded:
Brief History

Minor Basilica of Our Lady of the Assumption, nestled in the heart of Santa Maria, Ilocos Sur, is a beacon of faith and a masterpiece of Filipino-Baroque heritage. More commonly known as Santa Maria Church, this sacred edifice holds a unique place in the annals of Philippine history and architecture.

A UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1993, the basilica proudly stands among the esteemed “Baroque Churches of the Philippines.” Its distinctive Earthquake Baroque style is a profound reflection of the Filipino spirit—adapting European grandeur to local conditions. Its fortress-like structure, with thick walls and robust buttresses, was designed to safeguard the house of God against the very ground it stands on.

What truly sets the church apart is its extraordinary location. Unlike most colonial-era churches, Santa Maria Church stands atop a verdant hill, reached by a historic 85-step granite stairway. This strategic elevation not only offers panoramic views but also once served as a vital watchtower against potential threats—embodying both spiritual and physical defense.

From its humble beginnings as a visita in the 17th century to its elevation as a Minor Basilica in 2024, the church has been a spiritual sanctuary, a community cornerstone, and a source of enduring inspiration. Generations have gathered here to celebrate the sacraments, find solace, and deepen their devotion to Our Lady of the Assumption.

Adding to its profound significance, on November 4, 2024, the Catholic Bishops’ Conference of the Philippines officially included the Minor Basilica of Our Lady of the Assumption as one of the designated pilgrim churches for the Jubilee 2025 celebration. This special recognition invites the faithful from across the nation and beyond to undertake a spiritual journey to this historic site, seeking graces and deepening their communion with God during this sacred year.

You are invited to step through our ancient doors, climb the storied steps, and immerse yourself in the rich history, artistry, and unwavering faith that permeate every stone of this magnificent basilica. Experience the enduring legacy of a community united by prayer and protected by grace.

CLERGY

Rev. Fr. Ernesto A. Juarez Jr.

Parish Priest Director, Commision on Liturgy

Rev. Fr. Ramelle J. Regunay

Parochial Vicar Archivist, Archivo Nueva Segovia

item.title: Services
item.dc:creator: admin1
item.content:encoded:
Sacrament of Baptism

Requirements

  1. Photocopy of the child's PSA Birth Certificate or Certificate of Live Birth with Registry Number from the Local Civil Registry.
  2. Original or photocopy (if applicable) of the parents' Catholic Marriage Contract. Parents are required to be married in the Catholic Church. If not, an interview with the Parish Priest is required.
  3. Permission Letter from the Parish Church if the child's parents are not parishioners of the church where the baptism will take place.
  4. Pre-Baptismal Seminar: Both parents and godparents are typically required to attend a pre-baptismal seminar.
  5. Godparents (Ninongs & Ninangs) must be baptized and confirmed Catholics, at least 18 years old, should be practicing Catholics
  6. Baptismal Fee

Sacrament of Matrimony

Reservation Requirements

  1. Reservation Fee
  2. Attendance at the orientation on wedding rules and regulations
  3. Photocopy of the baptismal certificate of both parties
  4. Proof of inquiry/visit at the Chancery Office for foreigners or divorcees
  5. Church marriage certificate (for renewal of vows during wedding anniversaries)

Basic Requirements

  1. Original copies of the baptismal and confirmation certificates of the bride and groom with the notation "For Marriage Purposes" (Valid for 6 months)
  2. Marriage banns: to be brought at the respective parishes of the couple to be posted for three consecutive Sundays.
  3. Certificate of No Marriage from the PSA
  4. Canonical interview
  5. Pre-cana seminar
  6. Marriage License: to be secured from the Civil Registry of the city or town of either couple (Valid for 120 days or 4 months only)

Order of Christian Funerals

Requirements

  1. Death Certificate: Original or certified true copy. This is essential for all legal and ecclesiastical processes.
  2. Deceased's Information: Full legal name, date of birth, date of passing, and last known address.
  3. Next of Kin / Authorized Representative: Name and contact details of the person making the arrangements.
  4. Coordination with Parish Office: The funeral home will typically coordinate with the chosen parish for the schedule of the vigil/wake (if held in the church) and the Funeral Mass.
  5. Wake/Vigil: If the wake is held in a funeral home, the church may still have guidelines for the visit of the priest or for a prayer service/rosary.
  6. Funeral Mass
  7. Interment/Cremation: The Funeral Mass is typically followed by the procession to the cemetery or columbarium. If cremation has already occurred, the urn may be brought to the church for the Mass.
  8. Donation/Stipend: A donation or stipend for the priest and use of the church facilities is customary.

  1. Death Certificate: Original or certified true copy. This is essential for all legal and ecclesiastical processes.
  2. Deceased's Information: Full legal name, date of birth, date of passing, and last known address.
  3. Next of Kin / Authorized Representative: Name and contact details of the person making the arrangements.
  4. Coordination with Parish Office: The funeral home will typically coordinate with the chosen parish for the schedule of the vigil/wake (if held in the church) and the Funeral Mass.
  5. Wake/Vigil: If the wake is held in a funeral home, the church may still have guidelines for the visit of the priest or for a prayer service/rosary.
  6. Funeral Mass
  7. Interment/Cremation: The Funeral Mass is typically followed by the procession to the cemetery or columbarium. If cremation has already occurred, the urn may be brought to the church for the Mass.
  8. Donation/Stipend: A donation or stipend for the priest and use of the church facilities is customary.

item.content:encoded:
Sacrament of Matrimony

Sacrament of Matrimony

General Requirements

  • Free Consent
  • legally and canonically free
  • Baptized & Confirmed
  • Canonical Form

Other Requirements

  • Canonical Interview
  • Pre-Cana/Marriage Prep Seminar
  • New Baptismal CertificatesConfirmation Certificates
  • PSA Birth Certificates
  • PSA CENOMAR (Certificate of No Marriage)
  • Marriage License
  • Confession
Contact Us

item.title: Baptism
item.dc:creator: admin1
item.content:encoded:
Sacrament of Baptism

Sacrament of Baptism

General Requirements

  • Mandatory pre-baptism seminar for parents/godparents 
  • Godparents/Sponsor

Other Requirements

  • Child's Birth Certificate
  • Parents' Catholic Marriage Contract
  • Godparents' Certificates
  • Seminar Proof
  • Baptism Application form
  • Permission Letter
Contact Us

item.content:encoded:
Minor Basilica of Our Lady of the Assumption

Where History Towers and Faith Endures

Live Stream

Schedule

  • Timezone UTC+6
  • Speaker
  • Address

Mass

First Mass: 5:30 am

Second Mass: 7:00 am

Anticipated Mass: 5:00 pm

Office Hours

Monday - Friday: 8:00 am - 5:00 pm

Saturday: 8:00 am - 12:00 pm

Services

The Enduring Citadel of Ilocano Faith

The Minor Basilica of Our Lady of the Assumption, commonly known as Santa Maria Church, is a prominent Roman Catholic basilica in Santa Maria, Ilocos Sur, Philippines, also recognized as the Archdiocesan Shrine of Our Lady of the Assumption and Santa Maria Pro-Cathedral. Designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site on December 11, 1993, it's one of the four "Baroque Churches of the Philippines," celebrated for its distinct Spanish-era Baroque architecture. Currently serving as the Pro-Cathedral for the Archdiocese of Nueva Segovia while the Vigan Cathedral undergoes repairs, this unique structure of bricks and mortar stands atop a hill, having historically functioned as a lookout, a citadel, and a religious center during four centuries of Spanish administration. As such, it's a significant draw for both tourists and Catholic devotees in Ilocos Sur, reminding them of the region's rich colonial past.

More About Us

Our Mission

Vision / Mission

About Santa Maria Church

The Enduring Citadel of Ilocano Faith

The Minor Basilica of Our Lady of the Assumption, commonly known as Santa Maria Church, is a prominent Roman Catholic basilica in Santa Maria, Ilocos Sur, Philippines, also recognized as the Archdiocesan Shrine of Our Lady of the Assumption and Santa Maria Pro-Cathedral. Designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site on December 11, 1993, it's one of the four "Baroque Churches of the Philippines," celebrated for its distinct Spanish-era Baroque architecture. Currently serving as the Pro-Cathedral for the Archdiocese of Nueva Segovia while the Vigan Cathedral undergoes repairs, this unique structure of bricks and mortar stands atop a hill, having historically functioned as a lookout, a citadel, and a religious center during four centuries of Spanish administration. As such, it's a significant draw for both tourists and Catholic devotees in Ilocos Sur, reminding them of the region's rich colonial past.
